verses.verse: A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.[b] For the director. According to Mahalath. For singing. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
[c]O LORD, the God of my salvation, day and night I cry out to you.
Let my prayer come before you; give ear to my cry for help.
[d]For my soul[e] is filled with misery, and my life draws near to the netherworld.
I am numbered among those who go down to the pit;[f] all strength has failed me.
I have been abandoned among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave, like those whom you remember no longer and whom your hand has abandoned.[g]
[h]You have lowered me into the depths of the pit, into the darkest regions of the abyss.
Your wrath lies heavy upon me; all your waves engulf me. Selah
You have caused my closest friends to shun me and made me hateful in their sight. I am shut in with no means of escape,[i]
and my eyes grow dim[j] with my suffering. [k]Every day I call out to you, O LORD, and spread out my hands to you.
Do you perform wonders[l] for the dead? Do the shades rise up and give you praise? Selah
Is your kindness[m] celebrated in the grave, or your faithfulness in the tomb?
Are your wonders known in the region of darkness, or your righteous deeds in the land of oblivion?[n]
[o]But for my part, I cry out to you, O LORD; in the morning my prayer rises before you.
Why do you cast me away, O LORD?[p] Why do you hide your face from me?
Since infancy I have been wretched and close to death; I have borne your terrors and have now reached the point of exhaustion.
Your wrath has weighed down upon me; your terrors have destroyed me.
All day long they surround me like a flood; they encircle me completely.
